definition: to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Some reserves were named to cover the possibility of withdrawals.
sentences.chinese: 已指明一些替補隊員，爲可能有人退出比賽作準備。

sentences.english: Can the managers and the substitute players proceed to the waiting area.
sentences.chinese: 請教練員和替補隊員到替換席。

sentences.english: England brought on a sub in the second half.
sentences.chinese: 英國隊下半場換上了一名替補隊員。

sentences.english: We have several alternates on our team.
He was benched during the football game.
sentences.chinese: 足球賽時，他是替補隊員。

sentences.english: Two substitutes were called in during the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 這場籃球比賽起用了兩名替補隊員。

sentences.english: Even the substitutes on the sidelines joined in.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連場外的替補隊員也參與了這場打鬥。

sentences.english: The following year he made the team as a walk-on player.
sentences.chinese: 他通過不斷地練習，第二年就成爲了替補隊員。

sentences.english: Baggio was once again sidelined through injury.
sentences.chinese: 巴喬又一次因傷成爲替補隊員。
